physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fever and chills upon admission. Large multiple vegetations of the tricuspid valve and an abscess extending into the free wall of the right ventricle demonstrated by echocardiographic analysis.
Postoperative echocardiographic analysis demonstrated normal function of the reconstructed tricuspid valve and subvalvular apparatus. The patient is asymptomatic.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient improved from symptoms of sepsis and vegetations on the tricuspid valve to being asymptomatic at follow-up.
